content: quote: Originally posted by 21031127: //online.wsj.com/article/SB123992665198727459.html Did you actually read the article? Or are you simply reacting like "Rep. John Boehner of Ohio, the House Republican leader, said Wednesday he was offended that veterans were characterized as potential domestic terrorists." Perhaps you and Rep. Boehner missed the part where the FBI is concerned that veterans are the TARGETS of extremist recruitment. Anyone trained in weapons and tactics is a recruiting target of these groups. I rather liked a posting by one of the folks in a different but related thread...if the government is concerned that unemployed, disenfrachised veterans may join extremist groups, perhaps the government should offer them a job countering extremist groups. Being opposed to illegal immigration or abortion does not make you a right-wing extremist any more than buying a hybrid makes you an eco-terrorist.

content: quote: Originally posted by 21031127: //online.wsj.com/article/SB123992665198727459.html The leftist idiots in DHS maybe wanted to publicize something, anything, to somehow discredit many who attended the TEA parties. It backfired. DHS need not pass GO and can go directly to hell, far as I'm concerned. I proudly qualify as one of their "extremists." Ooooohhh--aaaaahhh. . . been one since the 1970s, I now see--and I don't give a damn what those obamanite fools and knaves blabber about. But what anybody with a brain can understand is that scarce resources are being urinated away on such polytickle control-freak nonsense while the real threats, islamonazis and druggies, appear to draw less attention than solid American citizens whose mistrust of the weenies in guvmint now seems all the more justified. Frickin' fools and knaves of the left. Had a military field grade commander been handed such a lousy, unfounded analysis by which to commit his unit to action, he'd have likely fired the incompetent daring to generate such unsubstantiated crap.

content: (U//FOUO) The North American Earth Liberation Front Press Office, the media arm of the Earth Liberation Front (ELF), published the following guidance for activists: “By inflicting as much economic damage as possible, the ELF can allow a given entity to decide if it is in their [sic] best economic interest to stop destroying life for the sake of profit.” (U) The most common leftwing extremist cyber attacks (particularly within the animal rights movement) in the past several years have included deletion of user accounts, flooding a company’s server with e-mails, and other types of e-mail assaults intended to force businesses to exhaust resources. — (U//FOUO) On 13 July 2007, an animal rights extremist hacked into a U.S. company’s computer system and deleted more than 300 associates’ user accounts. To restore the accounts, the perpetrator demanded that the company sell its shares in a corporation that conducts tests using animal subjects. — (U//FOUO) In October 2005, animal rights extremists launched an e-mail attack against a Milwaukee, Wisconsin firm that held stock in an animal testing laboratory. The firm subsequently sold its shares in the laboratory, with losses it estimated at approximately $1.4 million. — (U//FOUO) In late April 2005, animal rights extremists overwhelmed a U.S. company’s computer server with e-mail, which the company claims resulted in a loss of approximately $1.25 million. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

content: quote: (U//FOUO) The possible passage of new restrictions on firearms and the return of military veterans facing significant challenges reintegrating into their communities could lead to the potential emergence of terrorist groups or lone wolf extremists capable of carrying out violent attacks. This is a direct quote NOT taken outof context. Not to mention the fact they have NO FACTS TO BACK UP) ANYTHING STATED IN THIS POLICY. Which means it's someones OPINION only. The report is wrong and needs to be trashed. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin

LOA1 there was a Left wing report in january that gave more info than this garbage report did. It actually had groups that were active and were going to do something. This report does offend troops, but it doesn't give names of groups like the Left report did. The report is just propaganda by the Left. content: quote: Originally posted by 21031127: //online.wsj.com/article/SB123992665198727459.html The leftist idiots in DHS maybe wanted to publicize something, anything, to somehow discredit many who attended the TEA parties. It backfired. DHS need not pass GO and can go directly to hell, far as I'm concerned. I proudly qualify as one of their "extremists." Ooooohhh--aaaaahhh. . . been one since the 1970s, I now see--and I don't give a damn what those obamanite fools and knaves blabber about. But what anybody with a brain can understand is that scarce resources are being urinated away on such polytickle control-freak nonsense while the real threats, islamonazis and druggies, appear to draw less attention than solid American citizens whose mistrust of the weenies in guvmint now seems all the more justified. Frickin' fools and knaves of the left. Had a military field grade commander been handed such a lousy, unfounded analysis by which to commit his unit to action, he'd have likely fired the incompetent daring to generate such unsubstantiated crap.

content: (U//FOUO) The North American Earth Liberation Front Press Office, the media arm of the Earth Liberation Front (ELF), published the following guidance for activists: “By inflicting as much economic damage as possible, the ELF can allow a given entity to decide if it is in their [sic] best economic interest to stop destroying life for the sake of profit.” (U) The most common leftwing extremist cyber attacks (particularly within the animal rights movement) in the past several years have included deletion of user accounts, flooding a company’s server with e-mails, and other types of e-mail assaults intended to force businesses to exhaust resources. — (U//FOUO) On 13 July 2007, an animal rights extremist hacked into a U.S. company’s computer system and deleted more than 300 associates’ user accounts. To restore the accounts, the perpetrator demanded that the company sell its shares in a corporation that conducts tests using animal subjects. — (U//FOUO) In October 2005, animal rights extremists launched an e-mail attack against a Milwaukee, Wisconsin firm that held stock in an animal testing laboratory. The firm subsequently sold its shares in the laboratory, with losses it estimated at approximately $1.4 million. — (U//FOUO) In late April 2005, animal rights extremists overwhelmed a U.S. company’s computer server with e-mail, which the company claims resulted in a loss of approximately $1.25 million. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

To restore the accounts, the perpetrator demanded that the company sell its shares in a corporation that conducts tests using animal subjects. — (U//FOUO) In October 2005, animal rights extremists launched an e-mail attack against a Milwaukee, Wisconsin firm that held stock in an animal testing laboratory. The firm subsequently sold its shares in the laboratory, with losses it estimated at approximately $1.4 million. — (U//FOUO) In late April 2005, animal rights extremists overwhelmed a U.S. company’s computer server with e-mail, which the company claims resulted in a loss of approximately $1.25 million.
